org.apache.juneau.rest.mock2

Class MockRest

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.juneau.rest.mock2.MockRest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MockHttpConnection

    public class MockRest
extends Object
implements MockHttpConnection
    Creates a mocked interface against a REST resource class.

    Allows you to test your REST resource classes without a running servlet container.

    Example:

    public class MockTest { // Our REST resource to test. @Rest(serializers=JsonSerializer.Simple.class, parsers=JsonParser.class) public static class MyRest { @RestMethod(name=PUT, path="/String") public String echo(@Body String b) { return b; } } @Test public void testEcho() throws Exception { MockRest .create(MyRest.class) .put("/String", "'foo'") .execute() .assertStatus(200) .assertBody("'foo'"); }

    • Overview > juneau-rest-mock > MockRest

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public static MockRest.Builder create(Object impl)
        Creates a new builder with the specified REST implementation bean or bean class.

        No Accept or Content-Type header is specified by default.

        Parameters:
        impl - The REST bean or bean class annotated with @Rest.
        If a class, it must have a no-arg constructor.
        Returns:
        A new builder.

      • build

        public static MockRest build(Object impl)
        Convenience method for creating a MockRest over the specified REST implementation bean or bean class.

        Accept header is set to "application/json+simple" by default. Content-Type header is set to "application/json" by default.

        Equivalent to calling:

        MockRest.create(impl, SimpleJson.DEFAULT).build();

        Parameters:
        impl - The REST bean or bean class annotated with @Rest.
        If a class, it must have a no-arg constructor.
        Returns:
        A new MockRest object.

      • build

        public static MockRest build(Object impl,
                             Marshall m)
        Convenience method for creating a MockRest over the specified REST implementation bean or bean class.

        Accept and Content-Type headers are set to the primary media types on the specified marshall.

        Note that the marshall itself is not involved in any serialization or parsing.

        Equivalent to calling:

        MockRest.create(impl, SimpleJson.DEFAULT).marshall(m).build();

        Parameters:
        impl - The REST bean or bean class annotated with @Rest.
        If a class, it must have a no-arg constructor.
        m - The marshall to use for specifying the Accept and Content-Type headers.
        If null, headers will be reset.
        Returns:
        A new MockRest object.

      • build

        public static MockRest build(Object impl,
                             Serializer s,
                             Parser p)
        Convenience method for creating a MockRest over the specified REST implementation bean or bean class.

        Accept and Content-Type headers are set to the primary media types on the specified serializer and parser.

        Note that the marshall itself is not involved in any serialization or parsing.

        Equivalent to calling:

        MockRest.create(impl, SimpleJson.DEFAULT).serializer(s).parser(p).build();

        Parameters:
        impl - The REST bean or bean class annotated with @Rest.
        If a class, it must have a no-arg constructor.
        s - The serializer to use for specifying the Content-Type header.
        If null, header will be reset.
        p - The parser to use for specifying the Accept header.
        If null, header will be reset.
        Returns:
        A new MockRest object.

      • request

        public MockServletRequest request(String method,
                                  String path,
                                  Map<String,Object> headers,
                                  Object body)
        Performs a REST request against the REST interface.
        Specified by:
        request in interface MockHttpConnection
        Parameters:
        method - The HTTP method
        path - The URI path.
        headers - Optional headers to include in the request.
        body - The body of the request.
        Can be any of the following data types:
        • byte[]
        • Reader
        • InputStream
        • CharSequence
        Any other types are converted to a string using the toString() method.
        Returns:
        A new servlet request.
